author: Mohammad Ali
text:
The Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha here observed Republic Day as “black day,” while taking an oath to make India a “Hindu Rashtra.”

Activists owing allegiance to the Hindutva group waved black flags on the streets as a symbolic gesture to “boycott” and “mourn” the Constitution of India.

Pandit Ashok Sharma, national vice-president of the outfit, has been organising a protest against the Constitution for the last five decades.

Mr. Sharma told The Hindu : “The purpose of my life is to make this country a Hindu Rashtra.”

According to him, it was “only because of the anti-Hindu policy of Mahatma Gandhi and his equally anti-Hindu disciple [Jawaharlal] Nehru that India became a secular country.”

He received international attention last year after he proposed a ‘temple’ for Nathuram Godse, who assassinated Mahatma Gandhi.
title: Hindu Mahasabha observes ‘black day’ in Meerut
